Title: Needs Assessment
Description: Documentation of the needs assessments carried out for this contracting process or project addressing demand for the project or investment from the affected communities or users.

Title: Value for money analysis
Description: A summary of the value for money analysis carried out for the project, along with supporting figures, calculations and business case, based on projected or actual procurement outcomes.

Title: Technical Specifications
Description: Detailed technical information about goods or services to be provided.

Title: Service descriptions
Description: A high-level description of the services

Title: Estimated demand
Description: A narrative describing the estimated demand to be served (annually) by the project.

Title: Contract draft
Description: A draft or pro-forma copy of the contract.

Title: Contract schedules
Description: Any document which contains additional terms, obligations or information related to the contract, such as a schedule, appendix, annex, attachment or addendum.

Title: Signed Contract
Description: A copy of the signed contract. Consider providing both machine-readable (e.g. original PDF, Word or Open Document format files), and a separate document entry for scanned-signed pages where this is required.

Title: Feasibility study
Description: Documentation of feasibility studies carried out for this contracting process, providing information on net benefits or costs of the proposed goods, works or services.

Title: Environmental Impact
Description: Documentation of assessments of the environmental impacts (e.g. impacts on flora, fauna & woodlands, areas of natural beauty, carbon emissions etc.) and mitigation measures (e.g. pollution control, low carbon solutions, sustainable timber etc.) for this contracting process or project.

Title: Final Audit
Description: Documentation of a final audit carried out at the end of contract implementation.

Title: Tender Notice
Description: The formal notice that gives details of a tender. This may be a link to a downloadable document, to a web page, or to an official gazette in which the notice is contained.

Title: Evaluation Committee Details
Description: Information on the constitution of the evaluation committee

Title: Request for Qualification
Description: The set of documents issued by the procuring authority that constitute the basis of the qualification and potentially the pre-selection of candidates (the short list). Qualified (or short-listed candidates) will then be invited to submit a proposal (or to enter into a new phase prior to bid submission, such as a dialogue phase or interactive phase).

Title: Evaluation Criteria
Description: Documentation on how bids will be evaluated.

Title: Minutes
Description: Minutes of pre-bid meetings, or other relevant meetings.

Title: Shortlisted Firms
Description: Documentation providing information on shortlisted firms. Structured versions of this information can be provided using the bids extension.

Title: Negotiation Parameters
Description: A description of the parameters for negotiation with the preferred proponent

Title: Evaluation report
Description: Documentation on the evaluation of the bids and the application of the evaluation criteria, including the justification for the award

Title: Guarantees
Description: Documentation of guarantees relating to a contracting process or contract.

Title: Defaults
Description: Information on events of default

Title: Termination
Description: Information on contract termination

Title: Performance report
Description: Performance assessment reports

Title: Award Notice
Description: The formal notice that gives details of the contract award. This may be a link to a downloadable document, to a web page, or to an official gazette in which the notice is contained.

Title: Contract Notice
Description: The formal notice that gives details of a contract being signed and valid to start implementation. This may be a link to a downloadable document, to a web page, or to an official gazette in which the notice is contained.

Title: Completion certificate
Description: A completion certificate issued by a relevant authority providing evidence that works were completed to a certain level of quality. Completion certificates may only be relevant for particular kinds of contracting processes.

Title: Procurement Plan
Description: Documentation that sets out the basis for this particular contracting process.

Title: Bidding Documents
Description: Documentation for potential suppliers, describing the goals of the contract (e.g. goods and services to be procured), and the bidding process.

Title: Arrangements for ending contract
Description: Documentation of the arrangements for ending the contract(s).

Title: Physical progress reports
Description: Documentation on the status of implementation, usually against key milestones.

Title: Financial progress reports
Description: Documentation providing dates and amounts of stage payments made (against total amount) and the source of those payments, including cost overruns, if any. Structured versions of this information can be provided through contract implementation transactions.

Title: Public Hearing Notice
Description: Documentation of any public hearings that took place as part of the planning for this contracting process.

Title: Market Studies
Description: Documentation of any market studies that took place as part of the planning for this contracting process.

Title: Eligibility Criteria
Description: Detailed documents about the eligibility of bidders.

Title: Clarifications to bidders questions
Description: Documentation that provides replies to issues raised in pre-bid conferences or an enquiry processes.

Title: Assessment of government's assets and liabilities
Description: Documentation covering assessments of the government's assets and liabilities related to this contracting process.

Title: Provisions for management of risks and liabilities
Description: Documentation covering how risks will be managed as part of this contracting process.

Title: Winning Bid
Description: Documentation of the winning bid, including, wherever applicable, a full copy of the proposal received.

Title: Complaints and decisions
Description: Documentation of any complaints received, or decisions in response to complaints.

Title: Annexes to the Contract
Description: Copies of annexes and other supporting documentation related to the contract.

Title: Subcontracts
Description: Documentation detailing subcontracts and/or providing a copy of subcontracts themselves. Where OCDS data on the subcontracts exists, this can be declared using the relatedProcess block.

Title: Project plan
Description: Documentation of project planning for this contracting process, and, where applicable, a copy of the project plan document.

Title: Bill Of Quantity
Description: Documentation that provides itemized information on materials, parts and labour, and the terms and conditions for their provision, providing information that would enable bidders to price work effectively. Structured versions of item and quantity information at each of tender, award and contract stage can be provided using units within the items building block.

Title: Information on bidders
Description: Documentation on bidders or participants, their validation documents and any procedural exemptions for which they qualify

Title: Conflict of Interest
Description: Documentation of conflicts of interest declared or uncovered.

Title: Debarments
Description: Documentation of any debarments issued.

Title: Illustrations
Description: Images intended to provide supporting information. The URL for images should generally be directly to an image file which applications can display as part of a gallery of images. At the tender stage, images may be illustrations of goods, works or services required or for sale. At the implementation stage, images may be illustrations or visual evidence of physical progress.

Title: Bid Submission Documents
Description: Documentation submitted by a bidder as part of their proposal.

Title: Contract Summary
Description: Documentation providing an overview of the key terms and sections of the contract. Commonly used for large and complex contracts.

Title: Cancellation Details
Description: Documentation the arrangements, or reasons, for cancellation of a contracting process, award or specific contract.

Title: Project scope
Description: A description of the main outputs from the project that are being taken forward into construction (including type, quantity and units)

Title: Land and Settlement Impact
Description: State the amount of land and property that was acquired for the project (e.g. 25sq km land), and outline related impacts (e.g. archaeological issues (moved saxon burial site), local/indigenous settlements (relocated 5 indigenous villages of 500 villagers each), impacts on local businesses e.g. (30 business properties purchased)).

Title: Project evaluation
Description: Generally published at the conclusion of a project, providing a technical and financial summary of delivery.

Title: Budget approval
Description: Additional details about the approval of the budget.
